title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. B, ch. IV, subch. E, pt. 1200 - Rules of Professional Conduct
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. B, ch. IV, subch. E, pt. 1200 - Rules of Professional Conduct

State Regulations

Subpart  - Terminology (§ 1200.1.0)

Subpart  - Client-Lawyer Relationship (§ 1200.1.1 to 1200.1.18)

Subpart  - Counselor (§ 1200.2.1 to 1200.2.4)

Subpart  - Advocate (§ 1200.3.1 to 1200.3.9)

Subpart  - Transactions with Persons other than Clients (§ 1200.4.1 to 1200.4.5)

Subpart  - Law Firms and Associations (§ 1200.5.1 to 1200.5.8)

Subpart  - Public Service (§ 1200.6.1 to 1200.6.5)

Subpart  - Information About Legal Services (§ 1200.7.1 to 1200.7.5)

Subpart  - Maintaining the Integrity of the Profession (§ 1200.8.1 to 1200.8.5)

Subpart  - Standards of Civility (§ 1 to 2)

Preamble: The New York State Bar Association
has issued a Preamble, Scope and Comments to accompany these Rules. They are
not enacted with this Part, and where a conflict exists between a Rule and the

Preamble, Scope or a Comment, the Rule controls. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. B, ch. IV, subch. E, pt. 1200

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
